etymologies: mid 17th century: via French and Dutch from a local name in the Molucca Islands

definitions: a tree-dwelling marsupial with a rounded head and prehensile tail, native to New Guinea and northern Australia.

notes.text: Four genera in the family Phalangeridae: several species, including thespotted cuscus (Spilocuscus maculatus) and thegrey cuscus (Phalanger orientalis). See also phalanger

shortDefinitions: tree-dwelling marsupial with rounded head and prehensile tail, native to New Guinea and northern Australia
